front.title: Live Entity State Stream (LESS) protocol description

abstract.t: Virtual worlds, typically implemented as multi-user sharedsimulations, are becoming increasingly used for serious work inaddition to the traditional uses of research and entertainment.Whereas previous distributed simulation protocols have been designedwith narrow, time-definite scope, the LESS (Live Entity State Stream)protocol is designed to allow open-ended join and leave for amultitude of simulation peers. The LESS protocol specifies how peersof a simulation collaborate and share state to achieve a mutuallyagreed "collective hallucination," leading to a user-perceivableshared state of a simulated worlds.
